newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Mobil shuts Altona refining units for maintenance.
newsitem.headline: Mobil shuts Altona refining units for maintenance.

text.p: Mobil Australia Ltd will close one crude distillation unit (CDU) and three reformers at its 118,000-barrel-per-day (bpd) Altona refinery from May 27 to June 29 for maintenance, a company source said on Tuesday.
The source said turnaround involves the shutdown of a 55,000 bpd CDU No.3 and all three of its reformers with a total capacity of around 31,500-bpd.

Mobil plans its last refinery shutdown for the year in September when it will replace its existing 24,000-bpd thermal catalytic cracker (TCC) at Altona with a fluid catalytic cracker of the same capacity.
Maintenance work at its Adelaide refinery involving the shutdown of the 75,000-bpd CDU and the 27,000-bpd reformer was carried out between April 22 and May 2, the source said.
